thread.title: Jennifer Lawrence: Hollywood's gender gap on pay has her 'over' trying to be 'likable'
thread.title_full: Jennifer Lawrence: Hollywood's gender gap on pay has her 'over' trying to be 'likable'

author: Christie D&apos;Zurilla
title: Jennifer Lawrence: Hollywood's gender gap on pay has her 'over' trying to be 'likable'
text:
Jennifer Lawrence: Hollywood's gender gap on pay has her 'over' trying to be 'likable' Jennifer Lawrence Jason Merritt / Getty Images 
Jennifer Lawrence "didn't want to seem 'difficult' or 'spoiled'" while negotiating her "American Hustle" deal. Those days are gone, she says. 
Jennifer Lawrence "didn't want to seem 'difficult' or 'spoiled'" while negotiating her "American Hustle" deal. Those days are gone, she says. (Jason Merritt / Getty Images) Christie D'Zurilla Contact Reporter 
Sounds like the Sony hack that revealed a major gender gap in "American Hustle" paychecks changed Jennifer Lawrence's life more than the naked-picture hack that saw her personal pictures for Nicholas Hoult go public back in 2014. 
The latter simply made her angry . The former has her angry and resolved to do things differently moving forward, when it comes to negotiations and professional opinions. 
"It's hard for me to speak about my experience as a working woman because I can safely say my problems aren't exactly relatable," she writes in the newsletter Lenny .
